title: 110_hr1376
content: The Act titled "Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007" establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. The Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007 establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage, with amendments made to the Social Security Act to include this group. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act regarding Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents, including changes to specific sections such as 1902 and 1903. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, including 1902, 1905, 1916(I), and 1916A(b)(3), by updating references from "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XIX)" to "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII)". Amendments to the Social Security Act update references from "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XIX)" to "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII)" in various sections, including 1916(I), 1916A(b)(3), and 1937(a)(2)(B)(x). Effective date for these changes is set for calendar quarters beginning on or after October 1, 2007. The amendments to the Social Security Act update references to "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII)" in various sections, effective for calendar quarters starting on or after October 1, 2007. State plans for medical assistance under title XIX must comply with additional requirements, with exceptions for states requiring legislation to meet the new requirements. The first day of the first calendar quarter after the close of the State legislature's regular session following the enactment of this Act. Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session.
